Text: Uh, dude is this the beta or the stable release? And can I delete the included folders once the instalation is complete ? Thanks.

It's the final RTM that I've just downloaded today from microsoft's site. 

Yes you can delete them.

I installed ie9 on Windows7 Ultimate (not a licenced OS copy). In an hours time I uninstalled it and reverted back to ie8. Reason : After updates and install of ie9 it disabled my walpapers. Turned my desktop to Black. Later after reverting to ie8 still no luch. I had installed bingdynamic theme for win7. Desktop screen was black and whatever I did, could not change wallpaper. Finally I reinstalled windows 7. I even tried to use System Restore but failed. Other users please share your experience if any.
Just want to add. I did a direct download of ie9. Did not download ie9 from Sopolki
may carry spy and viruses..be aware!!
